page.title: 07HARTLEBURY CASTLE
page.content: The original manor was given to the {Bishop of Worcester}round about the year 850 by{King Burghred of Mercia. Fortified and crenellated by successive Bishops,it became their principal residence in the 16th Century.In 1846 Hartlebury became the sole palace of the{See of Worcester. Over the years Hartlebury has accommodated{Edward 1,}troops during the Civil War and has been a prison for Royalists and a College for clergy. In 1964,the North Wing was adapted into a museum becoming the{Hereford {and Worcester County Museum, illustrating the life of Worcestershire people through the centuries.Such a centre has become a learning place for many school children from a wide area.
